intro: Triplophyllum angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved triplophyllum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white ray florets, which bloom in the summer months. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
